example[0]: The singer got an enthusiastic reception.
example[2]: All the staff are enthusiastic about the project.
example[3]: The Irish are very enthusiastic about horse racing.
example[4]: I wanted to go, but Helen seemed less enthusiastic.
example[5]: ‘I’m sure we can do it, ’ she said, trying to sound enthusiastic.
example[6]: Your husband doesn’t look too enthusiastic about the idea.

example[11]: It’s nice to see such an enthusiastic crowd at the match.

definition[1]: feeling or showing a lot of interest or excitement about something
example[14]: He’s really enthusiastic about his new job.
example[15]: An enthusiastic crowd cheered the team onto the pitch.
definition[2]: wanting to do something or know about something very soon
example[16]: He was eager to hear every detail of her day.
example[17]: She was always eager for her turn on the catwalk.
example[18]: The room was full of eager young faces.
example[20]: She hasn’t much experience but she’s very keen.
example[21]: John was a keen student who worked very hard.
definition[4]: doing something in a very enthusiastic way, especially supporting something or making sure that people obey rules
example[22]: She was a zealous supporter of the revolution.
example[23]: The company has been extremely zealous in defending its interests.
example[24]: Officials have been very zealous in the application of the new regulations.
definition[5]: used when you want to emphasize that someone does something a lot or is very interested in something
example[26]: She was an avid reader all her life.
example[27]: I’ve become an avid collector of his work.
example[28]: Henry is an avid fan of the sport.
example[29]: As a schoolboy he had an avid interest in birds.
definition[6]: believing or feeling something very strongly and sincerely
example[30]: Galinsoga was one of Franco’s most fervent supporters.
example[31]: One of Allen 's fervent admirers was Richard Nixon.
example[32]: her fervent belief in promoting the work of good women artists
definition[7]: to like something very much and be very interested in it
example[34]: Since you’re so mad about clothes, you can help me choose a wedding dress.
definition[8]: to be very eager to do something
example[35]: I can’t wait to get started.
definition[9]: to feel pleased and excited because you know that something is going to happen soon
example[36]: I’m looking forward to the vacation.
